node.statement: We prove transitivity of H on Ω by showing the support graph Γ is connected. By Definition (Graph_Connectivity), if Γ is connected, then H acts transitively on Ω. We proceed by: (1) identifying all edges in Γ from each generator, (2) showing the Core {1,2,3,4,5,6} forms a connected subgraph, (3) showing each tail vertex connects to the Core, and (4) concluding Γ is connected.
